reviewText:
Oh Apogee  <3  a name that contributed greatly to my childhood.

Monster Bash is one of those classic Apogee platformer games that, while very difficult at times, you just can't help but love.
The art is still great, that charming cartoony style.
The music is catchy and fun.
The level design, while sometimes a little confusing, and more often than not, filled to the brim with awkward enemy placements that are specifically meant to cause you trouble, is great fun to explore and learn.
Surprisingly decent length game too, for an old platformer. And, of course, tons of items scattered around for points, and secrets aplenty! Some nice extra challenge for completionists who like to 100% levels.

Sure the game frustrates me to no end sometimes, with its unexpected attacks out of nowhere, and damn near impossible to avoid tricks and traps, but I can't stay angry at it.
It's just so fun, and brings me back to those wonderful days!

reviewText:
I remember when i was a kid this game was kinda considered as a horror game for me, i was playing it a lot but only at daytime :D

now after probably 18 years i have found it again on steam and WOW good old days :D the only thing i am missing is the horror feeling because it no longer scares me on the other hand it hypes me because i am playing it AGAIN! YES AGAIN!!!!

Back in 1990s there was a freeware" version of this game (Aka DEMO) and it was pretty long
date: you had full access to episode 1 which was long enough to make you believe you actually had played the complete game not a freeware. but these days games get released in funny prices $60 for less than DEMOs then $50 season passes which gives you a bit more access to the game time to time.\n\nGood old days that "gamers" used to be developers
recommended: today "businessmen" are the developers! just like this game says "R.I.P""

reviewText:
8/10

One more platformer from Apogee, Monster Bash does platforming very well. The game is very fun while also being very challenging, with lots of different powerups to use and levels that greatly vary from each other, both on design and on challenge level. It's also curious that for a game that looks cute and where you're supposed to save cats and dogs, it can be a quite gory game as enemies will explode into gory bits when they die.

The biggest downside to this game is that the boss fights are very lackluster, the final boss in the game in special.

But the ending completely makes up to that - it's one of the cutest game endings I've ever seen.
